title: Mike Cannon-Brookes bellyaches over Burmese reprimand
text:
Only naturally, Atlassian co-founder Mike Cannon-Brookes was in New York last week for the United Nations’ Climate Action Summit. “We're showing up in New York because we have a responsibility to act,” he declared. “If government won’t respond, we must.”

On Wednesday evening, the headline-hungry tech bro hosted beverages on Manhattan’s Lower East Side for the Australian journalists trailing Prime Minister Scott Morrison on his US trip.

His profound unhappiness with the Morrison government’s emissions reduction efforts is well-established. But over cocktails, Cannon-Brookes recounted his particular shame at copping an earful from Myanmar’s Environmental Conservation Minister U Ohn Win over Australia’s rank ecological violence.

Atlassian will reduce net emissions to zero by 2050? Much ado about nothing ... Bloomberg

Notwithstanding the common absurdity of a nouveau riche misfit designating himself our national representative at a multilateral conference, his trepidation at the Burmese reprimand is entirely needless.

According to World Bank analysis released in June, Myanmar’s forest cover declined at an annual rate of 1.2 per cent between 1990 and 2015 while marine exploitation has depleted the country’s fish stocks by as much as 90 per cent since 1979.
description: Atlassian will reduce net emissions to zero by 2050? Much ado about nothing ...
